Source code for Julius

# chr int to char
# ord char to int
import Colors

alphabet = ["abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"]
color = Colors.textMod()



[docs]def display_values(key, input):
    print("these are the user supplied values \n")
    print("The key selected is ", key)
    print("The selected text is ", input)




[docs]def print_text(user_string, mode):
    results = []
    stringy = ""
    if mode == 0:  # encoded
        for i in user_string:
            results.append(chr(i))
    else:  # decoded
        for i in user_string:
            results.append(i)
    print(stringy.join(results))




[docs]def encode(plain_text, key):
    # z is 122
    listPlainTest = list(plain_text.lower())
    encoded_text_list = []
    for x in listPlainTest:
        # handles ascii that aren't a-z
        if ord(x) < 97:  # spaces
            x = ord(x)
        elif ord(x) > 122:
            x = ord(x)
        # handle wrappings for over and underflows
        elif (ord(x) + (key % 26)) > 122:
            prev = x
            x = (ord(x) + (key % 26)) - 26
            pretty_print(prev, chr(x))
        elif (ord(x) + (key % 26)) < 97:
            prev = x
            x = (ord(x) + (key % 26)) + 26
            pretty_print(prev, chr(x))
        else:
            prev = x
            x = ord(x) + (key % 26)  # within the range of the alphabet
            pretty_print(prev, chr(x))
        encoded_text_list.append(x)
    return encoded_text_list




[docs]def pretty_print(prev, apres):
    prev_loc = alphabet[0].index(prev)
    apres_loc = alphabet[0].index(apres)
    if prev_loc > apres_loc:
        print(alphabet[0][0:apres_loc]+color.green+alphabet[0][apres_loc]+color.end+alphabet[0][apres_loc+1:prev_loc]+color.blue+alphabet[0][prev_loc]+color.end+alphabet[0][prev_loc+1:])
    else:
        print(alphabet[0][0:prev_loc] + color.blue + alphabet[0][prev_loc] + color.end + alphabet[0][prev_loc+1:apres_loc] + color.green +alphabet[0][apres_loc] + color.end + alphabet[0][apres_loc+1:])



[docs]def decode(encoded, key):
    decoded_list = []
    for x in encoded:
        if x < 97:  # spaces
            pass
        elif x > 122:
            pass
        elif (x - (key % 26)) > 122:
            prev = x
            x = (x - (key % 26) - 26)
            pretty_print(chr(prev),chr(x))
        elif ((x) - (key % 26)) < 97:
            prev = x
            x = ((x) - (key % 26)) + 26
            pretty_print(chr(prev),chr(x))
        else:
            prev = x
            x = x - (key % 26)
            pretty_print(chr(prev),chr(x))
        decoded_list.append(chr(x))
    return decoded_list


# the cipher only works for a-z, any other ascii remains
